title: Canyonlands National Park: Permits & Reservations
body: Explore This Park    Plan Your Visit     Basic Information     Permits & Reservations               Permits & Reservations       Backcountry Permits Day Use Permits Day-use Permits are required for four-wheel-drive, motorcycle, and bicycle travel on White Rim, Elephant Hill, Lavender Canyon and Horse Canyon/Peekaboo roads. Overnight Permits Overnight trips into the backcountry require an Overnight Backcountry Permit. River Permits Day and overnight trips on the rivers require a River Permit. Horseback Riding, and Pack- and Stock-Use Permits All pack- and saddle-stock use requires a permit.             Explore the Backcountry  Plan Your Backcountry Trip Now.  Or Make a Reservation.           Special Use Permits Special events, such as weddings, or activities such as commercial filming and photography, require a Special Use Permit.  Commercial Use Commercial outfitters and tour groups leading guided trips into the park must obtain a Commercial Use Authorization.  How Do I Make a Reservation? Reservations are available for group campsites in The Needles, and for day-use, overnight, and river permits.
